channel.title: poem on 采采流水

item.title: The More Loving One
item.description: The More Loving One ( W. H. Auden ) Looking up at the stars, I know quite well That, for all they care, I can go to hell, But on earth indifference is the least We have to dread from man or beast. How should we like it were stars to burn With a passion for us we could not return? If equal affection cannot be, Let the more loving one be me.
